text: Beautiful hotel, with fantastic rooms, amazing pools and calm atmosphere.When we arrived they offered us 'an inside view', The room was lovely, but the view was awful. We paid for an upgrade to a sea view room and it was excellent. We were able to watch the amazing sun set sitting out on the balcony. Rooms are well equipped, with a small fridge, safe, hairdryer and reasonably sized TV. Very little noise could be heard from outside the room despite only being a few metres from the lift.People (unfortunately are still 'reserving' sun beds, but there really is no need as there are so many spread out all over the different pool areas of the hotel.We were staying on a B&B basis, so didn't have any evening meals in the hotel, but we did have a few lunched at the pool bars, which were fine. Breakfast was fine, with plenty of choice, but it did get quite busy at times.There's not much to do in the resort of Calheta, but again, the resort has a relaxed atmosphere. Great place to chill out, but don't expect a lively place. A handful of places to eat on the marina, and a couple of other restaurants close by. 'Beach' at the hotel is stony, and can be difficult to get into the sea without some 'Croc' type footwear.

We stayed 1 week at the Jupiter Albufeira in early June. There are lots of pros so I don't want to slate the hotel - it is super clean and friendly. Staff are always helpful and the rooms are big and comfortable. The pool areas are clean and there is plenty there for kids above 5. We travelled with our 5 year old and 1 year old. Our 5 year old son loved the pool, the water park, the football pitch, and just generally enjoyed being there. However, the hotel didn't have anything on offer for our 1 year old. Evening meal times were from 6.30 pm and our 1 year old sleeps at 7 so that meant our dinner times were quite rushed and both kids were pretty grumpy by that point. It also meant that we couldn't make use of the bookable restaurants as they also opened at 6.30 and because it would require ordering off a menu, there would be more of a wait. I understand kids could stay up later on holiday of course, but ours are just too young and just get too grouchy if they stay up too late. That also meant that we missed the evening entertainment - partly because it was a bit out of the way of the hotel. The kids club looked great but our 5 year old wasn't interested. We did notice that there was some soft play equipment in there - this would have been fantastic for our 1 year old! I think the hotel could benefit from a small play area for toddlers/under 3s. All this would require is a small space indoors/outdoors with some smaller play equipment and softer play equipment. There was just nothing at all for our toddler.Overall - we enjoyed our week. And I suspect the hotel is just better enjoyed if your kids are over 5 or so. But not for toddlers.

Amazing,modern boutique hotel with great outdoor pools and spectacular view over the ocean. Oceanview room the one we stayed in was very spacious. Absolutey delicious, fresh seafood served a'la cart at the restaurant. Would definitely reccomend that hotel and come back again!
I really liked the location of the hotel, the layout, the food, but I liked the service staff at breakfast and dinner the most. The reception staff are also wonderful.

Belmar Spa & Beach Resort was a lovely surprise close to the beach. We did not use the hotel facilities as we spent most of the time away during the day, visiting the gorgeous coast around. But we, indeed, enjoyed our spacious and comfortable two-bedroom townhouse with balcony room. Very nice kitchen and living room. We really felt like home. We did not rent a car - we used cab all the time, but I would recommend to rent a car as it is easy to drive around and it is very hot/dry during summer to walk long distances. The hotel has a central restaurant to have your meal or you can order to have it at your privacy/room. Nearby restaurants have delivery service as well if you need. In downtown Lagos you find several options and it is 5/10 minutes by taxi. Lagos is a very special place and I would recommend Belmar hotel to enjoy your vacation.

When I saw the pictures of the hotel online I could not unseen it. Had to book it and experience it...and it did not disappointed. We stayed at Tivoli for 8 nights. At the time of booking there was no ocean view room available for the whole stay so we decided to change rooms when the one we wanted was free. The move was very smooth.Both rooms where very good size and clean. The ocean view was amazing. From our room, restaurant and the roof top bar. Pool was clean and not too busy despite the high season. We were always able to find a sunbed. Breakfast buffet had a good selection of food to choose from. Food at the restaurants was delicious.  Can say anything bad... but what truly made our stay were the members of staff. Can't remember the last time we felt so comfortable in the hotelLovely and smiley men at the door always welcoming us with a smile. Absolutely fantastic team at the diner service. Massive thank you to you all.We would love to return to Tivoli Carvoeiro again.

We stayed at this spacious two bedroom apartment with a rooftop terrace for three nights. Ample parking is available. The grounds were lovely. The views from the pool were beautiful, but the temperature of the pool was extremely cold making swimming almost impossible. No poolside drink service, although there is an outdoor bar present.Our kitchen was well equipped to prepare meals. There was a lovely patio on the ground level with two chairs and a table in which to enjoy a drink outside. There was a washing machine and a drying rack outside on the patio. The roof top terrace had a table and chairs, but only two loungers for four people. No cushions for the loungers.Housekeeping came every day. The apartment was clean, although the staircase leading to the rooftop was never swept, and I know this because of the large dead insect that was there the entire time. Our shower did leak onto the washroom floor, requiring the use of extra towels to absorb the water.. Our apartment also had a problem with ants. Many ants! On the main level and in the bedrooms. Insecticide was applied three times before we were able to enjoy an insect fee apartment. We were told the whole area is having a problem with ants. It might be helpful to remove the shag carpets from the bedroom and living room areas.The beds were very comfortable. There were only two small pillows. Extra pillows would have been nice.The beach is a short walk away with a nice outdoor restaurant. There is also a bus stop at the beach. The main town area is a short drive away with cafes, street vendors, restaurants, and grocery stores.There is a great restaurant by the water in town with a great rooftop view and a delicious buffet. Be careful walking on the cobblestone sidewalks, as it can be a trip hazard. Wear comfortable shoes.The hotel restaurant is average. We ordered well done steaks which came to us rare, and had to be returned. The shrimp dish was delicious.The sangria was great. The music entertainment was not so good.The reception desk staff was very polite and helpful. We received immediate assistance when our A/C was not working.I would return to this resort.

We stayed at the Jupiter Hotel Albufeira for a week in April (today is our final full day as of writing).I hope this is a comprehensive/balanced review of a fantastic hotel.Location:+ Situated in a primarily residential area with just an Irish pub adjacent - very quiet, well kept area.+ The entire hotel feels private and enclosed with tall bushes/walls.- The hotel is about a 35/40 minute walk from Albufeira Old Town (~2 mile) however there's a free shuttle bus (make sure to queue early for it!) that can take you here. Uber is widely available in Albufeira and costs about ‚Ç¨4 to/from hotel to Old Town which is very cheap!Accommodation:+ Two days prior to arriving, I emailed to ask if we could have a room that was on a higher floor as our son is a very light sleeper - we received a reply almost immediately and were given a room on the top floor (room 1044) on arrival.+ The Classic Family room was very spacious with two single beds together and a double sofa bed for our son.+ The room was absolutely spotless and modern - zero complaints whatsoever.+ The rooms seem to be very sound insulated as we couldn't hear anything from the rooms either side of us.+ Our room was pool facing but with the balcony door closed and being on the top floor of the hotel, the sound is very low.- My only criticism of our particular room is that it was above the area where the kids disco and entertainment is which goes on to 10pm and the speakers are incredibly loud. Next time I would get a room on the top floor but the opposite side of the hotel.Atmosphere:+ The hotel has a very lively, uplifting atmosphere. The numerous kids' entertainers and general staff are very pleasant - haven't had any negative experiences with staff at all.+ During the day, there is music playing at the poolside and different activities such as aqua Zumba which seemed to be popular.+ Despite being very busy while we stayed, there was never a time where I felt overwhelmed or claustrophobic - even at peak meal times.+ As stated before, the location of the hotel in a residential area is great also as there's no loud music or noise from outside of the grounds.+ At the side of the hotel there is a quiet pool which has a very chill vibe.Service:+ The level of service at this hotel is incredible - from the reception staff to the waiting staff to the cleaners.+ At meal times, used plates and cutlery are cleared very quickly (but not in a pushy way). Staff are always available to ask for another drink.+ Bar staff at the pool bar are very friendly.+ We had an issue with a slight leak from the shower which, within 5 minutes of reporting, someone from maintenance had arrived and checked the issue. Housekeeping cleaned up while we had dinner and it was as if nothing happened!Food & Drink:+ The food quality and options available are fantastic - really diverse choice of food each day.+ Breakfast time usually had the same, large selection of cold foods and hot foods such as eggs, bacon, hash browns etc however lunch and dinner was more diverse with different options each day.+ Each evening there was a different food theme (Arabic, American, French, Surf & Turf, Portuguese etc) which was nice. Quality of the food was impressive.+ There is an Italian section where there's freshly baked pizza and a selection of different pastas. You can also get your own custom pasta plate made up with whatever ingredients you want.+ There's two other restaurants - one A La Carte (wasn't overly impressed with it) and an All You Can Eat meat one which was lovely. Depending on your package, you should get one free dinner in each of these.+ There is practically food available throughout the day - be it the main buffet area or the small snack shack that has sandwiches, crisps, ice cream etc.+ The drink selection is extensive and there are no limits to how much you can drink.- My only criticism of the food is that it's not the warmest at times - even if you arrive for the beginning of dinner time (7pm).Activities:+ This hotel is very much family focused and there are a lot of activities for kids such as a kids club where they do crafts, different games around the hotel during the day, two play parks (one that has water) and big water slides. There's also an artificial football pitch which is well maintained.+ In the evening, there is a kids disco in a marquee at the side of the hotel with music, popcorn, candy floss and even different birds of prey/tropical birds one evening!+ The hotel also offers access to different tours and attractions such as Zoomarine but we didn't go this time.- The pools are VERY cold so prepare yourself for this. Once you've got in the pool and used to it, it's fine.Value for Money:+ This hotel is the definition of value for money - the peace of mind of not having to worry about going somewhere else for lunch or drinks and everything at your disposal is fantastic.+ I've travelled around the world - Spain, Portugal, France, Greece, Hungary, Italy, USA - this is the nicest, cleanest, friendliest hotel I've stayed in up to now.Comments in relation to points from other reviewers:+ The carpets in the halls are spotless and I seen them being cleaned on a couple of occasions - not sure what the issue is with these.+ The lifts are well organised and even with staying on the top floor, we never had to wait longer than a few minutes for one.Overall - this hotel is fantastic with a high quality finish, friendly staff, quality choice of food and drink and the perfect location for a family holiday.We have never stayed someone twice but will definitely be back here next year!!!

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: As a boutique city hotel, we can't praise Valverde enough. The location is great; the interiors are beautiful, as is the external courtyard space complete with feature pool; the food is very good - but most of all, the team there is absolutely amazing. From our initial enquiry facilitated by the highly professional Tomas, through to check in; recommendations on restaurants and sight seeing attractions (thank you to Tomas again, Reubin and others); delicious breakfasts; top notch bar service and every other element of our Valverde experience, our stay there could not have been bettered. The hotel is currently in the midst of an expansion - we wish them well and can't wait to see the newly remodelled version, but we do hope that the qualities that make Valverde so special will live on. Well done team and thank you all!
The staff are all very attentive, but I would like to highlight the sympathy and kindness of Juana! It was a girl who in the area of restoration was always impeccable.

I had a really nice stay at the Lisbon Destination Hostel. The place is nice, confortable, clean and the location perfect. I was very well welcomed/received, people are great. The breakfast is good (espacially the pancakes)!

I stayed in the house during a surf camp for 1 week. I loved it! Very nice and clean room, good facilities, close to the beach and really cool people! An absolute top were cakes made by a British girl living there (she made them time to time) - the best brownies I've ever had! :)

Family of 12 staying here for our summer holiday. 4 apartments between us and they are great! Biggest apartment we have ever had in a hotel, all are massive and much bigger than the pictures suggest. Clean and tidy with all the facilities you need - even a washing machine in the kitchen although we aren‚Äôt doing any laundry on holiday but great for a back up. The pool is large and lovely, great temperature and salt water isn‚Äôt too salty you can hardly tell. Sunbeds are all comfy and the pool opens 9-8 so you have time to get up and get a bed without a mad dash at 6am with towels. The kids love the pool area, entertainment with volley ball in the pool, darts and ping pong is good. The bar serves actual decent beer not the usual watered down rubbish. We are self catering but facilities for all inclusive look good. Beach is close as are loads of lovely restaurants. The staff can‚Äôt do enough for you and the apartment is cleaned well once a day which is ample. Can‚Äôt fault it. Would come back again definitely. We are only one week in but it‚Äôs lovely and can‚Äôt wait for the next week! We were a bit dubious at first as the rooms look slightly dated but you can‚Äôt tell it‚Äôs all part of the Portuguese charm, comfy beds, good power shower, air con is almost too good we have to turn it up so we don‚Äôt freeze which is a good thing! Sofa bed is comfy, really can‚Äôt fault it at all. We will definitely return. Arcade for the children, gym is great and well stocked for all workouts, bars are good in the complex and the interior of the hotel is lovely with fountains and statuettes. Brilliant üåü üåü üåü üåü

Baleal beaches are unique. And Captain¬¥s, the crew and the beaches behind Captain¬¥s Hostel are  unforgettable. The service is very good, and  the breakfast is super.  The tips were awesome and I found very good restaurants. Fantastic time over there. I will be back for sure.
The apartment was lovely in a great location and the team were welcoming and helpful. I would definitely come back again.

First of all the rooms are lovely and clean, as are the shared washing areas. There's a nice 'common room' bit with a hammock! Breakfast is pancakes, breads & spreads. You can pay 8 euros for dinner which is hot & cold starter, main and dessert - absolutely great quality and quantity of food. Once we'd done it once we didn't eat anywhere else (apart from at the linked hostel 'sunset destination hostel which has a roof terrace and a little pool!). Staff were brilliant, really friendly and ready to chat. We went on one of the free walking tours which was great, and also a paid one to Sintra, as well as going to jazz night. It was all great, would definitely recommend this hostel!

It was my second stay at Captain‚Äôs. this time with full house. despite of that it was not crowded or uncomfortable, on the contrary, I felt like visiting an old friend's house.I was picked up from Peniche bus station and straight away went  surfing a nearby secret spot.I could talk a lot but will try to focus on most important aspects: - free breakfast, served each day by supernice staff;  free fruits and little chocolates available for guests; surf storage place; bikes that you can rent free of charge and explore nearby villages or simply checkout waves each morning (do not forget to lock the bike ;) and interesting people from all over the world that you can meet and party with.I hooked up with surf camp from Slovakia, which uses Captain‚Äôs as their base; it was great as I could improve my surf skills with Ben and Peter- the instructors. We had one barbecue party with 2 guys playing guitars, one guy playing watering can as drums, and few others singingJack Johnson ‚ÄúOld train to breakdown‚Äù which was quite epic...Visit Captain‚Äôs and you will not regret it! High five to Ze and Sabina and see you next time.

Great Place,  Nice peaple, amazing experience!  Very good breakfast. If you want have fun, this Is The Best Place of algarve. Surfcamp Is cool,  from morning To afternoon you Will enjoy, It Will be difficult To come Back At home!

The only thing I did not like about this hostel is that I didn't wanna leave. Such a nice and chilled out place. The staff made us feel as if we we're at home, rather than guests in a hostel. They made sure everyone felt welcome and got to know each other. And don't even get me started on the amazing breakfast... I loved everything about this place, the staff, the facilities and the cutest dog in the world. You guys rock!! xx Anna and Georgie

Loved, loved loved our stay. Cannot fault it. Rooms were spotless and such a unique building with quirky touches. Restaurants were impressive and the location was second to none. We stayed in the suite side of the building and we felt like we had our own apartment. We just let ourselves in and took the tiny but oh so wonderful lift to our floor.Stay here...you won't be disappointed.

Stayed here for 4 nights and wish I was there longer. The hotel is beautiful. Service was wonderful. Room was spacious and had everything I needed. Everyone spoke excellent english and went out of their way to make me feel comfortable. Even the young man who helped me check out early in the morning was wonderful, I can't remember his name but he was such a great employee. My only complaint was the breakfast, I felt it was not worth the value, but that is just me. Other then that, stay here if you can. Has a lovely pool and small gym with the essentials.

Excellent and modern amenities. Very spacious, comfortable and modern rooms. Excellent location and views. Premium customer service. I recommend this hotel to family and friends who want to enjoy a unique experience.

All round good business hotel.  Excellent rooms, good facilities. Internet access is rather expensive which is my only real gripe. The location is easy to get to from the airport, but is a way out of the centre and there is nothing in the way of restuarants or shops near the hotel,.

Stayed here on the recommendation of some friends and loved it.  It's not the type of place that we would normally look for or stay at but we certainly will in the future.  It's a great old building with very quirky d√©cor.  The hotel rooms are not full of sleek marble and chrome or up to the minute gadgets (although there was an espresso machine) but we had a perfectly adequate bathroom, with a lovely big modern shower, and a very comfortable bed.  We were not troubled by any of the noise issues that other reviewers have mentioned, although I can imagine that this might be a problem at the weekends, particularly in the summer.  The breakfasts were great with a good selection and the ability to have eggs freshly cooked for you if you wanted them.  The lady on the breakfast service was lovely.  It's in a great location with easy access to the historic centre and loads of nightlife on the doorstep.  Would stay here again.

This hotel is a little gem.  We always ask for a corner room.  The room is a good size and the beds are comfy.  The bathrooms are a good size and attractive.  The breakfast is really nice and there is something for everyone.  All the staff, in reception and the breakfast room are friendly and efficient.There are lots of restaurants close by and the centre of the city is an interesting 15 min walk.Staying here is a very pleasant experience.

Exceptional bed and breakfast. The owners are very attentive and kind and ensure that we are all comfortable and that we have all we need. The rooms are very cozy and clean and provide with the necessary for a comfortable stay. The breakfast is amazing as they prepare them with very fresh and natural ingredients and even offer us some pancakes and crepes or handmade pastry. They are very kind and warm make us feel welcome and at home. It is a very nice location, super close to the beach and there are very nice Restaurante‚Äôs in the surroundings. There is good taste and one of the owners does some amazing handcrafts that nicely decorates the walls of the home.

This is basically a 5 star resort hotel. It is enormous, has several areas around the pool and has a lot of activities. Only stayed one night so did not partake in much but definitely the place to stay if you want a top hotel. Beautiful design and the room was beautiful

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We visited Reids Palace for 5 days and had a junior suite, the view was enchanting and the bed sumptuously comfortable. We shall definitely stay again as this unique Hotel has it all, position, excellent staff and history

Poor value for a 5* hotel, not good value. Opened before time , should not have charged 5* rates for 3* service . Did not receive room requested. Not enough umbrellas at pool. Open wiring in reception toilets, no fire instructions on bedroom doors, no internal directories in rooms, shall I go onüò°

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: I had lunch in the pool side restaurant earlier this moth. The hotel reception has been much updated since my last visit as has the restaurant with chilled food counters and a central bar. This is a good move. The food as always was outstanding as was the service. Particular reference should be made to the deserts which a amazing. Thank you again

We were at the Saccharum at the beginning of August 2023. We were very impressed. A very great hotel. Very clean rooms, very friendly staff, delicious food and above all a lot of choice. We particularly liked the live cooking. The infinity pool on the roof was a real highlight. Children are also very welcome here. In the Fly Lounge you can enjoy live music from various artists every evening while enjoying delicious cocktails. The Fly Lounge offers a great ambience on the 8th floor of the hotel. The cocktails are also excellent, by the way. The massage in the SPA area was also very relaxing.The only drawback: The hotel is very far outside of Funchal (about 45 minutes away). But it is absolutely wonderful to relax and escape the stress of everyday life. You can really switch off here.A big thank you to the Saccharum team. We had a great vacation and would definitely recommend the Saccharum.Best wishes from Germany,The Jost family

Excellent location. Very nice hotel. The room was clean, and cleaned daily. The folks at the desk were really helpful. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many sights, tons of places to eat and drink‚Ä¶ we really enjoyed our time in Lisbon. We recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay here again.

Great venue, great pool, super bar and pool service. Room air conditioning inadequate to the point of not sleeping well. Breakfast service was atrocious which given the good quality of the breakfast items was disappointing. Over priced and underwhelming buffet dinner. Generally staff pressured, hotel management would be better running a car wash as clearly the rest is too much for them. The service ethic of the past which is omni-present in the staff has been lost. The recent renovation is aesthetically pleasing and appropriately stylish but a clear lack of functional management and backing infrastructure has reduced the hospitality to a disappointing level. Absolutely not a 5 star.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The very best place to stay in Funchal. All the others stay far behind the class that the Belmont Reid‚Äôs Palace has to offer. Starting with the Concierge, with Golden Keys, the receptionists with a touch of class and familiarity. Special thanks to Benjamin. All the staff is high class. The hotel is so very charming with the building impeccable conserved, stunning views to the harbor and the see. First class swimming pools with sea water and a SPA with everything you need.Strongly recommended.Lu√≠s Bouceiro.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Reid‚Äôs was everything we hoped for. It‚Äôs gorgeous - the pictures don‚Äôt do it justice. The staff is terrific: thoughtful and patient front desk staff, fantastic servers, professional housekeeping, and the transportation team who picked us up and dropped us off at the airport. It's a very historic hotel, and you felt like you'd stepped back in time.Here‚Äôs what we loved:- The views are incredible!- The hotel is impeccable - flowers and tropical plants everywhere. We had beautiful Calla Lilies in a vase in our bathroom- The food and drinks are reasonably priced for a 5-star hotel - I recommend a Negroni!- The beds and sheets are incredibly comfortable- The staff pays attention to everyone- The breakfast buffet was one of the biggest I've ever seen and had loads of fresh fruit like papaya, mango, passionfruit- We received an upgrade to a suite, and it was huge and felt very luxurious- No mysterious ambient electronic/mechanical sounds in the hotel you so often experience in large American hotels (usually the A/C or elevators)- No TVs in the lounge or bar areas! (they have public rooms with TVs that some guests used to watch a football/soccer match) It was so lovely not to be bombarded with news or sports- The only music was a live pianist - no easy-listening Spotify playlists to endure- The canapes and nuts we received each evening while having a Negroni on the terraceI could go on and on! We were there during a big storm in Madeira that caused loads of flight cancellations, and you could tell the hotel staff was stressed having to deal with canceled reservations, questions from guests (including us), and folks who left for the airport and then had to return (also us). They handled it like pros, and when our flight was inevitably canceled, they welcomed us back to the hotel to remain for the day until our rebooked flight ten hours later.The only negative was a group of guests who arrived a few days into our stay and proceeded to FaceTime their friends from the bar area (they'd all had a few drinks - no judgment,  but it made them a lot louder). The recent acceptance of having to endure someone‚Äôs loud FaceTime or phone call (or game or videos‚Ä¶) in a public place is a major pet peeve of mine, and while these paying guests had as much right to be there as I did, I would‚Äôve loved it if a manager had politely asked them to take their call outside. It‚Äôs a historic 5-star hotel with a dress code for Afternoon Tea and dinner. Why not ban loud phone calls, too?All of the other guests were lovely and respectful. We can‚Äôt wait to go back!

We enjoyed two weeks of pure pleasure, accommodation was superb, attentive staff, delicious well presented food, memorable evenings. The pools and leisure area next the ocean provides the perfect environment to relax with the sound of the ocean waves breaking on the nearby rocks.

Best AccommodationSo friendly, clean rooms a lot of postive Energy and the woman mrs. vanta is so lovely i recommend everyone to go there!And its direct in the city centre!Beste Unterkunft in Lissabon

At first I thought this hotel might be a bit out of the way but when I stood on the terrace looking out on a wonderful sunrise over the Atlantic I was happy I choose this hotel. There are plenty of great resturants within a 10 minute ride and there's a shuttle bus to Ponta Delgada. And that's much less important than the fact the hotel is very comfortable and the staff are endlessly helpful. A number of people have commented on the glass partition between the bathroom and the bedroom. All I can say is 'when the view is this good why miss out?' And I forgot to mention the  beach with natural swimming pools.

A really fine hotel room superb and well cleaned each day.Breakfast time is a bit chaotic with the phrase \self service\" meaning you also have to find your own cups saucers cutlery sugar salt etc.Also if getting a room on the Vilamoura side please be warned that on Friday night the locals create a lot of noise  coming out of the casino from 4am to 7am shouting and reviing cars.Did complain but was met with indifference by the night porter"

I only had the bed and breakfast option but was not disappointed. The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice and set me up for the day. The room was far nicer than I expected (pictures may have been old when I booked), with a small kitchenette as a nice extra touch and a decent sized balcony. Staff were friendly and only too happy to help with my limited Potugese. Would love to stay again.

New modern hotel. Overall we were very happy with it. We liked where it is located on the north side of the island. Seemed centrally located to everything. It‚Äôs in the quiet country more then a busy city. You definitely need a car out here. Don‚Äôt rely on taxis. Large parking lot with plenty of spaces.The pool area is picturesque. Nice infinity pool overlooking the ocean. Although I would recommend more/better shade options. The huts they have are old and worn out. Barely provide any shade.The rooms are clean and modern. Beds are super comfy. They provide some drinks and a couple snacks in the mini fridge. We loved the robes they provided. They also provide toiletries. All you need to bring is a toothbrush and tooth paste. They provided body soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. A safe is provided for your valuables. We had a room facing the mountains, and at first I was bummed out we didn‚Äôt have an ocean view.  But in the end I was glad we had the Mountain View. It was quiet/more private  compared to the pool side. They do not have irons in the room which was strange to me. Every hotel I have been in had an iron and iron board. You think they would take into consideration that you just traveled here and your clothes may be wrinkly from the suitcase, but no big deal.The breakfast buffet in the morning was perfect for us as we traveled around the island all day. It was a good ‚Äúget up and go‚Äù option. The food is basic but substantial for the purpose.Some negative aspects of the hotel and areas they needs improvement on are the bar and restaurant. Service is lacking. It seemed as though they all lacked experience and consideration of your time. They were best at not making eye contact and ignoring you. The only way we were served was by sitting at the bar. We came in for lunch one day and sat at the table with no menu for 15 minutes. We finally got up and sat at the bar. They seemed to always be in the weeds, and never had any structure. No one seems to work one specific area, they all just ran around to the outside, inside, bar, etc. drinks looked yummy, but took a lot of time and effort to make one.  To me they need a better manager and more help. The food is expensive and just ok. You can drive 4 minutes down the road and get way better food for a fraction of the price. I think we ate 3 times here at the hotel, and it was all out of desperation.In my opinion, the reason this is a four star hotel is because of the service/food at the bar and restaurant. Also, I believe this should be an adults only hotel. The pool area is so serene and quiet, but is ruined by a screaming/crying child. The acoustics in the restaurants and hallways are also not conducive to screaming children. We got a massage in the spa one morning and you could hear the kids screaming in the breakfast area and playroom which is located right across the hall from the spa.It is a very nice hotel, and we would stay here again. Staff is friendly and do try their best. I would just correct those few things that I mentioned, and then this actuallyMight be a 5 star hotel.

It was all very good !!Immaculate service very friendly staff!I'll go more oftenImmaculate food quality.Butter chicken very good, that's what I liked the most.Jeera pulao very good ..With this service I will come back more often and recommend

Natura was excellent value for money. Well located especially if you are on foot. Spacious clean accom. lovely pool area with plenty of loungers. Lots of nearby eateries, shops etc. The staff were just the best.

A total disappointment, the sofa is broken, impossible to sleep after arguing, they put me in a 90 cm bed, my uncle's room has no electricity or air and the sofa for two is rubbish after √¢‚Äö¬¨5,600 for the two rooms, reservations for special restaurants, everything reserved for up to two days later and only for 4 people we go as a family there are 7 of us and they really don't give us any options I hope I change my mind but so far everything is very bad and we are still waiting for the lady to come who has gone I don't know where and she is not coming blessed

Just returned from our first trip to Madeira. Chose this hotel because of all the positive reviews and can honestly say we were not disappointed. From the minute we arrived to the day we left all the staff were fantastic with a special mention for Telma and Valerie (reception) for whom no questions were too difficult or time consuming to answer, Juan (are you lost sir? private joke!) and Marcia in the pool bar. Also Miguel the hardworking and pleasant courtesy bus driver. In my opinion breakfast was first rate, plenty of choice with hot and cold options.The evening meals in the restaurant were excellent with both traditional and international food.We were lucky enough to have room 603 in the panoramic tower with fantastic views over the harbour and the city. The room itself was very spacious with lots of hanging space and storage. A fantastic bathroom with an excellent shower and plenty of hot water. The rooms were cleaned daily by the very professional housekeeping staff who were friendly and did a great job. So once again a very big thank you to all the staff and look forward to seeing you again in March.

I loved this hotel.  The location cannot be beat, the breakfast is lovely, fresh, and plentiful.  The rooms themselves are a little dated in decor, but they are immaculate.  The hotel is small and friendly and the staff are so helpful.  I look forward to returning when the renovations are complete!

I had an incredible stay at Altis Belem. The rooms, location and breakfast can√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t be faulted. The only thing I would say is the cleanliness of the roof could have been better. I don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t know if that√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s because it wasn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t being used as much to the time of year, but it wasn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel - but I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢m still giving the hotel a 5 star review as the service and everything else was absolutely fantastic.

We have just returned from a 3 night break in Porto.  The location of the hotel was perfect for us with sensational views over the river and especially from the newly opened roof terrace.  The terrace proved to be an additional bonus for viewing the Red Bull world air race over the river Douro.We were unaware that we had booked the weekend of the race which meant that road closures proved problematical at times.  However the Reception staff ( especially Fabio) dealt with all our queries in a very professional manner.  They volunteered to telephone all the tour operators and restaurants to re-arrange times or meeting places on our behalf. They even organised complimentary jugs of sangria on the roof terrace whilst we watched the aeroplanes racing.  The barman also gave us an impromptu tutorial on his preparation of all the different variations of gin!The rooms were comfortable and extremely clean with lovely soft pillows.  The restaurant provided an excellent breakfast to start the day.We had a really good city break in this delightful hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to Porto.

We stayed here in October half term it was very nice clean and well maintained the service was good and the area was lovely. Pool was a little cold but it didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t bother my son who was in everyday. Beach was close by too which was perfect.

I have stayed in a suite quite spacious and with a large balcony with ocean view (amazing to view and listen to the seagulls). Due to the weather I haven't tried the pool in the outdoor, but it has a very large lawn with a lot of chairs which you can use to enjoy the portuguese sun. The indoor pool was amazing with the water on a lovely 28 degrees! The breakfast was also a good experience.A must in this hotel it's the location which you can see in the pictures! Nearby the ocean, nearby the beach, and you can also find good restaurants nearby...The only thing less positive it's the lack of a parking lot. Although I was able to find a nearby place to park my car, in a more busy season it could be more difficult.

Stayed at the pestana viking in February 2015 for a week. Fantastic views from our room,attentive and friendly staff. Leisure facilities a real treat. Thanks Pestana viking we will definitely be back.

Excellent hotel, welcoming staff who did not hesitate to change our room upon arrival to have views of the Tagus estuary. Spacious room with terrace. Located 5/10 minutes from the pier to reach the center of Lisbon in 20 minutes. We take the ferry with the natives for a pittance.Hearty and varied breakfast, very appetizing.The must, the swimming pool on the rooftops, sunny with views of the Tagus.Everything was perfect

We enjoyed our 4 night stay at this apartment hotel in Albufeira.  We were upgraded to a room on the 4th floor so we had an upstairs bedroom and a second balcony. Staff and grounds are very well taken care of.If you are looking to party, this is really close to the strip.  Its a bit loud at night due to the roundabout but not unbearable.  If you are looking for something very close to the grocery store, and the strip. This is the place!The pool is shared with Ourabay hotel next door, and is very well taken care of, only one day we had a problem with getting a lounge chair in front of the pool and waited about 10 minutes, the staff will actually clear towels away from the people who just \reserve\" their chairs early with a towel on it.Your are a 15 minute walk from either beach (Sao. Joao or Praia D Oura).The king sized bed in our room was 2 double beds pushed together and the room does have its own air conditioner."

If your Looking for a base in Lisbon, I think this is ideal.booked via Booking.com we opted for the superior room(216 - 2nd floor monument/main road facing).at a cost of 410 euro, cannot compare to a standard room but I was (again) disappointed in the fact that European hotels fail to put a Kettle and cups in a \superior\" room(a bugbear of mine) there was a medium size safe
month: 2 very good size single beds pulled together with 2 pillows on each
column13: probably due to health n safety.Room was cleaned everyday with towels changed when needed.although road facing and close to airport flight path we heard only emergency services and occasional motor bikes
column14: double glazing fitted.We chose to get to hotel by metro
column17: buy ticket and travel 10 stops on red route to SALDANHA
column18: change to yellow route(heading to Rato) 2 stops
column19: exit at Marques de Pombal and hotel is right in front of you.The Hotel is large and busy and booking in can be a slow process(can only get in room after 2pm
column21: when we arrive there was one lady dealing with 6/7 people took 1/2 hour
column22: similarly the Bar at night has only one hard working staff member at any given time
column23: this means table service is virtually impossible
column26: but sports channel on a tv screenBreakfast: fairly good
column27: basic hot breakfast bacon(not English)/ scrambled eggs/mushrooms/ beans(fried eggs on request) or go continental
column28: various cakes/meats/cheese /fruit/The hotel is a good half-hour walk to main tourist area(Restauradores) we enjoyed the(down hill) walk of  Avenida Da Liberdade  but you can take Metro.There is the lovely Parque Eduard just to the left of main exit that is also the area for hop on/hop off buses

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: The staff here were very accommodating and helpful.  The room was clean and nice with a great view of the city.  The breakfast buffet was super yummy with a great variety. The location worked for us as well.

My husband and I enjoyed a quick 2 night stay @ PortoSense earlier this month and it exceeded all our expectations! Despite the dreary weather Porto greeted us with, our apartment was cozy and was equipped with all the amenities we required for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.The apartments, needless to say, were very well decorated and furnished. WiFi connectivity was great. The only feedback we had, is around the size of the shower. It was fairly small, even for my decently small frame (AUS size 6). Haha.Fantastic location. All in all, really enjoyable and highly recommend!

Stayed 1 night in a Superior Room. All staff were very attentive and helpful, in a relaxed way. We had to shorten our stay from 2 to 1 night, and this was handled fine by the hotel - thanks again! The room was very creatively designed, with hidden cabinets and drawers, all in a very modern/clean style. The wall separating the bathroom from the bathroom was glass from floor to ceiling, which gave a nice cool impression. The hotel is located on the waterfront and next to no less than two busy roads and the train tracks, so it is not as calm as some may want. However, the sound insulation works well and allowed even a light sleeper like me to get a good night's rest. The great bed probably helped a lot in this regard, too. Overall a fine stay - I'll be back!

Beautiful building, check.Amazing service, check.Outstanding Portuguese cuisine, check.Chic spot to hang out and make new friends, check.All in all, the Myriad hotel has made a lasting impression on my visit to Lisbon. It is a spectacle to see whether or not you are staying in the hotel.I would recommend this spot to any of my friends, but I will be clear on a few things. The hotel itself is impeccable, however, the location is its only downside. It is a bit of a trek (20 mins) to the center of the city every time you decide to leave the hotel, and could be much worse during rush hour, but the hotel experience definitely makes up for it.

This is a little gem of a hotel tucked away in a residential neighborhood yet walking distance to amenities, beach and restaurants. Loved the Cactus room with private patio and view of pool/spa. The kitchenette is a great bonus if you want to make your own breakfast.Only thing lacking in the room was a safe - would have really liked to have a secure box for valuables.

Booked to stay at this hotel for a weekend break from Friday-Sunday. And by far had the most amazing time away in Portugal for a weekend break at this hotel! Staff was really lovely and helpful, food was amazing, room cleanliness was spot on! Must say I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ve been solo travelling and coming to this hotel they actually get the staff to escort you to your rooms which was really lovely to see! Hotel is amazing as is situated right by the beach! Only down side I would say is hotel is a big complex so there is a lot of walking to do just incase any people have maybe certain health issues! Other than that amazing! Deffo would return at some point in the near future

The apartment is in an excellent location which is just beside the Douro.  Everything in Porto is within walking distance.  There are a lot of restaurant nearby and we've been to Jimao (just opposite to the apartment door) and Chez Lapin (3 minutes walk) which are all very nice.We had the S.Clara room on the 1st floor.  The apartment itself is clean and comfortable.  The furniture is from IKEA and the facilities in the kitchen are well maintained and easy for use.Communicated with the apartment owner by e-mail and the owner gave very clear instruction about how to check-in and where to park our car.  The e-mail communication is clear and timely.The car can be parked in the underground garage in the Infante square which is 3 minutes walk.  The apartment offers parking card which costs 16 EUR per 24 hours.  But be careful that the parking card had date on it.  We've stayed for 3 days and wrongly use the 3rd days parking card on our 1st day and then we have to pay additional 20+ EUR for our 3rd day's parking.Anyway, no compliant to the apartment itself.  Everything is perfect.

I would say that it is an ok hotel.  Above the average breakfast.  Rooms need some remodeling (e.g. outdated carpet). Nevertheless, as per my researches I am not sure if it is easy to get something much better in Coimbra.

This is on the Tagus with great views from most rooms.  Although the hotel is five years old it appears new and is very modern.  The bar has great cocktails and views.  Staff is excellent.  Taxis to center of Lisbon usually about 8 Euros.  We were worried that we were not in the heart of Lisbon, but would definitely stay here again.  They also have a Michelin rated restaurant but we did not get the chance to go.   Great walking and sight seeing in adjacent to the property.Also great breakfast, better than most European buffets.I was a bit surprised that the coffee in the room was 5 Euros per shot, so would avoid that as this is typically complementary.

extra plus for everything starting check in room was amazing food great stuff friendly i would recommend this resort to all my friends i will come back 100 percent writing review wit a big smile remembering my vacation

We stayed a night at the Vial Gale Coimbra. The hotels is close to the city center, but it¬¥s better if you got a car. Parking is available in front of the hotel or at the hotel garage (i think it was 7,5‚Ç¨ per day).The hotel is modern and like a boutique hotel. There is a great outdoor and indoor pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great, a big choice of everything - good quality at all.The rooms were big, modern, nice flat TV and big beds. Everything was clean.I can highly recommend you that hotel. Price was good as well.WIFI worked also well.I¬¥d go there again!The only thing is, it¬¥s a little bit far from the center and the University (by foot)!

Had a really lovely weekend. The staff in the hotel were very helpful. They also arranged for us to go on a lovely boat ride on the river. Hotel is very clean. Food is amazing. Spa was wonderful. Parking was free.

My only hesitation in writing this review is that the next time I look to stay here it may be booked! Incredible property, clean rooms, and great staff. Breakfast was very nice and the experience was once in a lifetime! Steps from the beach but elevated so there is privacy.

Not a good hotel. Dirty glasses, noisy air conditioning that doesn't cool, old bathroom, too big and not suitable for a shower, everything gets wet. wIfI doesn't work, at least in some rooms. A modern and beautiful lobby. It doesn't fit in with the rest of the hotel. Very polite staff, but unprepared to provide information. Lack of training.

The hotel is very hype, top modern, it offers you an excellent and very friendly service and its location directly on the water is superb!Rooms are fancy and very particular, but no privacy at all because the bathroom is open though not separated from the room. If you are taking a bath you can be seen from the room unless you close a curtain. Strange feeling... If you are not too familiar with technical equipment you might have difficulties in this hotel. Everything is high tech, fully automatic, light switches complicated to use, the tea/coffee maker as well. Curtains close only if you press the right button etc - all in all too modern for my personal taste. May be I am too \old\" for a hotel which is full of technique from A to Z. Therefore I didn't find it very relaxing to stay there. But it's an exciting place for trendsetters
month: for people who love modern facilities and a spectacular architecture."
